text: Steve McManaman (born 11 February 1972) is a former English football player. He has played for England national team. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League National cup League cup Europe Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Liverpool 1990–91 First Division 2 0 1 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 3 0 1991–92 30 5 8 3 5 3 8 0 — 51 11 1992–93 Premier League 31 4 1 0 5 2 3 1 — 40 7 1993–94 30 2 2 0 2 0 — — 34 2 1994–95 40 7 7 0 8 2 — — 55 9 1995–96 38 6 7 2 4 1 4 1 — 53 10 1996–97 37 7 2 0 4 2 8 1 — 51 10 1997–98 36 11 1 0 5 0 4 1 — 46 12 1998–99 28 4 0 0 0 0 3 1 — 31 5 Total 272 46 29 5 33 10 30 5 0 0 364 66 Real Madrid 1999–2000 La Liga 28 3 5 0 — 13 1 4 0 50 4 2000–01 28 2 0 0 — 11 0 1 0 40 2 2001–02 23 2 4 0 — 13 2 1 0 41 4 2002–03 15 1 6 1 — 6 2 0 0 27 4 Total 94 8 15 1 — 43 5 6 0 158 14 Manchester City 2003–04 Premier League 22 0 3 0 1 0 4 0 — 30 0 2004–05 13 0 1 0 0 0 — — 14 0 Total 35 0 4 0 1 0 4 0 — 44 0 Career total 401 54 48 6 34 10 77 10 6 0 566 80 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals England 1994 1 0 1995 6 0 1996 9 0 1997 3 0 1998 3 0 1999 4 2 2000 5 1 2001 6 0 Total 37 3 :Scores and results list England's goal tally first, score column indicates score after each McManaman goal.
